newsitem.title: FRANCE: French motorist disputes fine for jet plane speed.
newsitem.headline: French motorist disputes fine for jet plane speed.

text.p: A French motorist is disputing a fine imposed by a police notice accusing him of driving at 980 kph (610 mph) -- faster than a jet airliner -- on a road near the Alpine city of Grenoble.
Pascal Cazy told TF1 television on Friday said police later sent him a a second notice, correcting the speed to 98 kph (61 mph). But the corrected notice had him driving in the wrong direction.
"I think my lawyer can reasonably argue there was a mistake," he said.
